Submodules¶

plugsy.AbstractPlugin module¶

Defines Abstract Plugin and Interface that all plugins must derive from

class plugsy.AbstractPlugin.AbstractPlugin(plugsy, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread, plugsy.utils.Logger.Logger

Constructor

Parameters:
  • plugsy – Parent PlugSy object
  • name – The name of the plugin. Optional, overrides package name
activate()[source]¶

Activates the plugin and starts the thread

deactivate()[source]¶

Deactivates the plugin and calls the plugin stop method

get_dependencies()[source]¶

Fetches the plugin’s dependencies

Returns:Plugin dependencies as a list of strings (plugin names)
get_name()[source]¶

Gets the plugins name

Returns:Plugin name
init_logging()[source]¶

Initialises plugin logging

is_activated()[source]¶

Checks whether the plugin has been activated

Returns:True if activated, otherwise False
is_core_plugin()[source]¶

Checks whether the plugin is a core plugin (within the core subpackage)

Returns:True if plugin is a core plugin, otherwise False
is_initialised()[source]¶

Checks if the plugin has been initialised

Returns:True if initialised, otherwise False
load_configuration(configuration)[source]¶

Loads the plugin configuration into the plugin object

Parameters:configuration – Plugin configuration module
run()[source]¶

Plugin Main run method holding the main plugin code. Called upon plugin activation Must be overriden by derived classes (plugins)

Raises:NotImplementedError If plugin hasn’t overridden method
set_core_plugin()[source]¶

sets the plugin as a core plugin when called

set_dependencies(dependencies)[source]¶

Sets the plugin’s dependencies

Parameters:dependencies – A list of plugins that the plugin depends on
stop()[source]¶

Plugin stop method. Stops plugin execution by setting stop event to iterrupt actions

plugsy.Config module¶

Holds global PlugSy config

Plugsy Package Exceptions

To be raised in the event of an Addon plugin Circular Dependency

Parameters:message – Exception message
exception plugsy.Exceptions.AddonPluginsStillRunning(plugin)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

To be raised if trying to deactive a core plugin but there are still add on plugins running

Constructor

Parameters:plugin – The Plugin object being deactivated
exception plugsy.Exceptions.CorePluginCircularDependency(message)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

To be raised in the event of a Core plugin Circular Dependency

Constructor

Parameters:message – Exception message
exception plugsy.Exceptions.DependentRunning(plugin, dependent)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

To be raised if a plugin is being deactivated, but there are other plugins running which depend upon this plugin

Constructor

Parameters:
  • plugin – The Plugin object being deactivated
  • dependent – The dependent plugin object
exception plugsy.Exceptions.InvalidDependency(message)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

To be raised in the event of an invalid plugin dependency, such as a core plugin depending on an addon plugin

Constructor

Parameters:message – Exception message
exception plugsy.Exceptions.InvalidPlugin(plugin_name, message)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

To be raised when trying to import a broken/invalid Plugsy plugin

Constructor

Parameters:
  • plugin_name – The name of the plugin at fault
  • message – Exception message
exception plugsy.Exceptions.MissingDependencyError(plugin, dependency)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

To be raised in the event of a missing plugin dependency

Constructor

Parameters:
  • plugin – Plugin object
  • dependency – Plugin object’s failed dependency

Parameters:message – Exception message

Bases: Exception

To be raised if a plugin does not exist

Constructor

Parameters:name – The name of the plugin
exception plugsy.Exceptions.SubpackageImportError(subpackage, import_exception)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

To be raised in the event of a fatal subpackage import (core, addon)

Constructor

Parameters:
  • subpackage – The name of the failed subpackage
  • import_exception – The actual import exception

plugsy.Plugsy module¶

Plugsy - Plugin System

class plugsy.Plugsy.Plugsy(safe_mode=False, debug_level='', debug_log_path='')[source]¶

Bases: plugsy.utils.Logger.Logger

Constructor

Parameters:
  • safe_mode – Boolean specifying whether Plugsy should be run in safe mode. In safe mode, only the core plugins will be loaded
  • debug_level – Level of debug. Should be one or INFO, DEBUG, WARNING or ERROR
  • debug_log_path – Optional peth to a debug log file. WIll be created and used for logging if specified
ADDON_DIR = 'addon'¶
CORE_DIR = 'core'¶
ROOT_PLUGIN_PACKAGE = 'plugins'¶
activate_plugins(plugin_names=[], ignore_addon_dep_failures=False)[source]¶

Activates Plugsy plugins

Parameters:
  • plugin_names – Optional list of specific plugins to activate
  • ignore_addon_dep_failures – Boolean specifying whether dependency failures should be ignored or raised when loading Addon plugins
deactivate_plugins(plugin_names=[])[source]¶

Deactivates all plugins, or a specific plugin

Parameters:plugin_names – Optional list of plugin names to deactivate
get_plugin(plugin_name)[source]¶

Fetch the plugin object of a specific plugin

Parameters:plugin_name – The name of the plugin to fetch
Returns:The relevant plugin object
get_plugins(plugin_name=None)[source]¶

Fetches PlugSy plugins

Parameters:plugin_name – The name of a specific plugin to get (optional)
Returns:A list of PlugSy plugin objects
is_safe_mode_enabled()[source]¶

Return the boolean value of __safe_mode

Returns:True or False
